Michael Arrington , who wrote that his blog was about to break the story about Eric Schmidt being tired and wanting out last summer. An interview with the three Google leaders convinced him to hold off, Michael Arrington wrote. Google insisted the story wasn't accurate, wasn't even close to accurate, and generally contained no accuracy whatsoever, Michael Arrington wrote.`` We killed the story, since their denials seemed fairly straightforward and honest, and we found no other independent sources.'' substance called`` red mercury'' that, according to local lore, can be found in the throats of ancient mummies. Some people think it has magical powers and can be used to summon spirits. They live thinking about it. They could kill each other to get it, Zahi Hawass said.`` When I enter any place in Egypt, people ask me all the time about this.''
